<hr>
<!-- ======== START OF CLASS DATA ======== -->
<h2>
<font size="-1">
org.apache.catalina</font>
<br>
Interface Wrapper</h2>
<dl>
<dt><b>All Superinterfaces:</b> </dt><dd><a href="../../../org/apache/catalina/Container.html" title="interface in org.apache.catalina">Container</a></dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dt><b>All Known Implementing Classes:</b> </dt><dd><a href="../../../org/apache/catalina/core/StandardWrapper.html" title="class in org.apache.catalina.core">StandardWrapper</a></dd>
</dl>
<hr>
<dl>
<dt>public interface <b>Wrapper</b></dt><dt>extends <a href="../../../org/apache/catalina/Container.html" title="interface in org.apache.catalina">Container</a></dt></dl>

<p>
A <b>Wrapper</b> is a Container that represents an individual servlet
 definition from the deployment descriptor of the web application.  It
 provides a convenient mechanism to use Interceptors that see every single
 request to the servlet represented by this definition.
 </p><p>
 Implementations of Wrapper are responsible for managing the servlet life
 cycle for their underlying servlet class, including calling init() and
 destroy() at appropriate times, as well as respecting the existence of
 the SingleThreadModel declaration on the servlet class itself.
 </p><p>
 The parent Container attached to a Wrapper will generally be an
 implementation of Context, representing the servlet context (and
 therefore the web application) within which this servlet executes.
 </p><p>
 Child Containers are not allowed on Wrapper implementations, so the
 <code>addChild()</code> method should throw an
 <code>IllegalArgumentException</code>.
</p><p>

</p><p>
</p><dl>
<dt><b>Version:</b></dt>
  <dd>$Revision: 1.5 $ $Date: 2004/05/26 15:28:42 $</dd>
<dt><b>Author:</b></dt>
  <dd>Craig R. McClanahan</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<p>

<!-- ============ FIELD DETAIL =========== -->


<!-- ========= CONSTRUCTOR DETAIL ======== -->


<!-- ============ METHOD DETAIL ========== -->

<a name="method_detail"><!-- --></a>
</p><table border="1" width="100%" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" summary="">
<tbody><tr bgcolor="#CCCCFF" class="TableHeadingColor">
<td colspan="1"><font size="+2">
<b>Method Detail</b></font></td>

</tbody></table>

<a name="getAvailable()"><!-- --></a><h3>
getAvailable</h3>
<pre>public long <b>getAvailable</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the available date/time for this servlet, in milliseconds since
 the epoch.  If this date/time is in the future, any request for this
 servlet will return an SC_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE error.  If it is zero,
 the servlet is currently available.  A value equal to Long.MAX_VALUE
 is considered to mean that unavailability is permanent.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="setAvailable(long)"><!-- --></a><h3>
setAvailable</h3>
<pre>public void <b>setAvailable</b>(long&nbsp;available)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Set the available date/time for this servlet, in milliseconds since the
 epoch.  If this date/time is in the future, any request for this servlet
 will return an SC_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE error.  A value equal to
 Long.MAX_VALUE is considered to mean that unavailability is permanent.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>available</code> - The new available date/time</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="getJspFile()"><!-- --></a><h3>
getJspFile</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String <b>getJspFile</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the context-relative URI of the JSP file for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="setJspFile(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
setJspFile</h3>
<pre>public void <b>setJspFile</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;jspFile)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Set the context-relative URI of the JSP file for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>jspFile</code> - JSP file URI</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="getLoadOnStartup()"><!-- --></a><h3>
getLoadOnStartup</h3>
<pre>public int <b>getLoadOnStartup</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the load-on-startup order value (negative value means
 load on first call).
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="setLoadOnStartup(int)"><!-- --></a><h3>
setLoadOnStartup</h3>
<pre>public void <b>setLoadOnStartup</b>(int&nbsp;value)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Set the load-on-startup order value (negative value means
 load on first call).
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>value</code> - New load-on-startup value</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="getRunAs()"><!-- --></a><h3>
getRunAs</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String <b>getRunAs</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the run-as identity for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="setRunAs(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
setRunAs</h3>
<pre>public void <b>setRunAs</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;runAs)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Set the run-as identity for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>runAs</code> - New run-as identity value</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="getServletClass()"><!-- --></a><h3>
getServletClass</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String <b>getServletClass</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the fully qualified servlet class name for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="setServletClass(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
setServletClass</h3>
<pre>public void <b>setServletClass</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;servletClass)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Set the fully qualified servlet class name for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>servletClass</code> - Servlet class name</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="isUnavailable()"><!-- --></a><h3>
isUnavailable</h3>
<pre>public boolean <b>isUnavailable</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Is this servlet currently unavailable?
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="addInitParameter(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
addInitParameter</h3>
<pre>public void <b>addInitParameter</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;name,
                             java.lang.String&nbsp;value)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Add a new servlet initialization parameter for this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>name</code> - Name of this initialization parameter to add</dd><dd><code>value</code> - Value of this initialization parameter to add</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="addInstanceListener(org.apache.catalina.InstanceListener)"><!-- --></a><h3>
addInstanceListener</h3>
<pre>public void <b>addInstanceListener</b>(<a href="../../../org/apache/catalina/InstanceListener.html" title="interface in org.apache.catalina">InstanceListener</a>&nbsp;listener)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Add a new listener interested in InstanceEvents.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>listener</code> - The new listener</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="addMapping(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
addMapping</h3>
<pre>public void <b>addMapping</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;mapping)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Add a mapping associated with the Wrapper.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>mapping</code> - The new wrapper mapping</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="addSecurityReference(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
addSecurityReference</h3>
<pre>public void <b>addSecurityReference</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;name,
                                 java.lang.String&nbsp;link)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Add a new security role reference record to the set of records for
 this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>name</code> - Role name used within this servlet</dd><dd><code>link</code> - Role name used within the web application</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="allocate()"><!-- --></a><h3>
allocate</h3>
<pre>public javax.servlet.Servlet <b>allocate</b>()
                               throws javax.servlet.ServletException</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Allocate an initialized instance of this Servlet that is ready to have
 its <code>service()</code> method called.  If the servlet class does
 not implement <code>SingleThreadModel</code>, the (only) initialized
 instance may be returned immediately.  If the servlet class implements
 <code>SingleThreadModel</code>, the Wrapper implementation must ensure
 that this instance is not allocated again until it is deallocated by a
 call to <code>deallocate()</code>.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>

<dt><b>Throws:</b>
</dt><dd><code>javax.servlet.ServletException</code> - if the servlet init() method threw
  an exception
</dd><dd><code>javax.servlet.ServletException</code> - if a loading error occurs</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="deallocate(javax.servlet.Servlet)"><!-- --></a><h3>
deallocate</h3>
<pre>public void <b>deallocate</b>(javax.servlet.Servlet&nbsp;servlet)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return this previously allocated servlet to the pool of available
 instances.  If this servlet class does not implement SingleThreadModel,
 no action is actually required.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>servlet</code> - The servlet to be returned
</dd><dt><b>Throws:</b>
</dt><dd><code>javax.servlet.ServletException</code> - if a deallocation error occurs</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="findInitParameter(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
findInitParameter</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String <b>findInitParameter</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;name)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the value for the specified initialization parameter name,
 if any; otherwise return <code>null</code>.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>name</code> - Name of the requested initialization parameter</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="findInitParameters()"><!-- --></a><h3>
findInitParameters</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String[] <b>findInitParameters</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the names of all defined initialization parameters for this
 servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="findMappings()"><!-- --></a><h3>
findMappings</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String[] <b>findMappings</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the mappings associated with this wrapper.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="findSecurityReference(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
findSecurityReference</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String <b>findSecurityReference</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;name)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the security role link for the specified security role
 reference name, if any; otherwise return <code>null</code>.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>name</code> - Security role reference used within this servlet</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="findSecurityReferences()"><!-- --></a><h3>
findSecurityReferences</h3>
<pre>public java.lang.String[] <b>findSecurityReferences</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Return the set of security role reference names associated with
 this servlet, if any; otherwise return a zero-length array.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="incrementErrorCount()"><!-- --></a><h3>
incrementErrorCount</h3>
<pre>public void <b>incrementErrorCount</b>()</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Increment the error count value used when monitoring.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="load()"><!-- --></a><h3>
load</h3>
<pre>public void <b>load</b>()
          throws javax.servlet.ServletException</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Load and initialize an instance of this servlet, if there is not already
 at least one initialized instance.  This can be used, for example, to
 load servlets that are marked in the deployment descriptor to be loaded
 at server startup time.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>

<dt><b>Throws:</b>
</dt><dd><code>javax.servlet.ServletException</code> - if the servlet init() method threw
  an exception
</dd><dd><code>javax.servlet.ServletException</code> - if some other loading problem occurs</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="removeInitParameter(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
removeInitParameter</h3>
<pre>public void <b>removeInitParameter</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;name)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Remove the specified initialization parameter from this servlet.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>name</code> - Name of the initialization parameter to remove</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="removeInstanceListener(org.apache.catalina.InstanceListener)"><!-- --></a><h3>
removeInstanceListener</h3>
<pre>public void <b>removeInstanceListener</b>(<a href="../../../org/apache/catalina/InstanceListener.html" title="interface in org.apache.catalina">InstanceListener</a>&nbsp;listener)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Remove a listener no longer interested in InstanceEvents.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>listener</code> - The listener to remove</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="removeMapping(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
removeMapping</h3>
<pre>public void <b>removeMapping</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;mapping)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Remove a mapping associated with the wrapper.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>mapping</code> - The pattern to remove</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="removeSecurityReference(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></a><h3>
removeSecurityReference</h3>
<pre>public void <b>removeSecurityReference</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;name)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Remove any security role reference for the specified role name.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>name</code> - Security role used within this servlet to be removed</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="unavailable(javax.servlet.UnavailableException)"><!-- --></a><h3>
unavailable</h3>
<pre>public void <b>unavailable</b>(javax.servlet.UnavailableException&nbsp;unavailable)</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Process an UnavailableException, marking this servlet as unavailable
 for the specified amount of time.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>
<dt><b>Parameters:</b></dt><dd><code>unavailable</code> - The exception that occurred, or <code>null</code>
  to mark this servlet as permanently unavailable</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<hr>

<a name="unload()"><!-- --></a><h3>
unload</h3>
<pre>public void <b>unload</b>()
            throws javax.servlet.ServletException</pre>
<dl>
<dd>Unload all initialized instances of this servlet, after calling the
 <code>destroy()</code> method for each instance.  This can be used,
 for example, prior to shutting down the entire servlet engine, or
 prior to reloading all of the classes from the Loader associated with
 our Loader's repository.
<p>
</p></dd><dd><dl>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><dl>

<dt><b>Throws:</b>
</dt><dd><code>javax.servlet.ServletException</code> - if an unload error occurs</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<!-- ========= END OF CLASS DATA ========= -->
<hr>
